sections.heading: Overview
content:
Uttam K. Sinha, MD, is vice chairman and an associate professor of surgery
in the department of otolaryngology at the University of Southern California
School of Medicine. He is also director of the school's Voice Center and the
microvascular laboratory in the department of otolaryngology. Sinha has
expertise in tonsillectomy, microvascular surgery, laryngeal surgery, head and
neck oncology, plastic and reconstructive surgery, endoscopic sinus surgery,
and head and neck trauma.

Sinha received his medical degree from Calcutta University in India and
completed a fellowship in neuroanatomy at the House Ear Institute in Los
Angeles. He completed a research fellowship in neuroscience at the University
of Southern California where he also completed his residency in head and neck
surgery. He did his clinical fellowship in microvascular and reconstructive
surgery at Mt. Sinai Hospital in New York, and joined the USC faculty in
1996.
